doc.after: In November 2002, Justin Timberlake released his debut solo album Justified;[1] it produced the US top-five singles "Rock Your Body" and "Cry Me a River".[2] "Cry Me a River" has been credited for having helped the album sell and peak on the music charts.[3] Justified sold up to four million copies in the US alone.[3] Although the album established his career outside his then-band 'NSYNC,[4] Timberlake, who was then 22 years old, was "at a crossroads" and felt he was at the stage of being "burnt out",[3][5] and thought he had lost his voice "in regards to knowing what (and how) he wanted to sing".[5] Timberlake stated that Justified had been years in the making, and a record that would re-create its success would be a challenge he was not ready to take.[6]
